body:
> General note, that might be worth bringing up on the mailing list: code can (and does) check whether the user has "modified" preferences (ie whether a pref has a value on the user branch, using the pref service's prefHasUserValue method) as a short cut in some cases. Changing the default value with an experiment in that case would in such cases potentially not yield the result you expect. I don't expect this to be a serious problem in practice, but it seems like it's worth flagging up for QE testing things or when coordinating with devs as something to look out for, as behaviour could potentially be different when comparing the preference experiment with QE setting the pref in about:config.

I dunno if it should live in our docs (probably?), but a short guide on designing and implementing a preference experiment on the Firefox for developers seems like it'd be a nice place to put this.
